intro: Psiadiella, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are herbaceous perennials, often with dark green, waxy leaves and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Psiadiella species are known for their toxicity, containing various alkaloids that can be harmful to humans and animals. They are often cultivated in gardens for their ornamental value despite their poisonous nature.
